definition: to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]
classifier for a ream of paper
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)

sentences.chinese: 李导游对此倒是一副外交辞令。

sentences.english: But, beneath the rhetoric, things are shifting fast.
sentences.chinese: 但在这些辞令背后，形势正迅速转变。

sentences.english: No need for diplomacy, it really is very good.
sentences.chinese: 这儿不用外交辞令，是真的很好听。

sentences.english: This is couched in diplomatic language, but the intention is clear.
sentences.chinese: 这是措辞在外交辞令，但用意是清楚的。

sentences.english: Official rhetoric has long claimed that Japan is bent on reconquest.
sentences.chinese: 外交辞令方面很早就表明日本有再次侵略的野心。

sentences.english: The key-note speaker certainly has the gift of gab.
sentences.chinese: 这位演讲者无疑善于辞令。

sentences.english: It was nice for the Party to have a leader again with some relish for words.
sentences.chinese: 党又有了一位善于辞令的领袖，这是可喜的。

definition: variant of 言辭|言辞[yan2 ci2]
to be glib in one's speech and wear an ingratiating expression (idiom)
variant of 辭令|辞令[ci2 ling4]
wording/way of expressing something/turn of phrase/diction
lit. to have a tongue like a reed (idiom)/fig. to have a glib tongue
be smooth and slick (in establishing social relations)
